TREESA CHERIA, W/O. CHERIA, AGED 62 YEARS, MANAVALAN HOUSE, KARAYAMPARAMBU, KARUKUTTY VILLAGE, ERNAKULAM DISTRICT. BY ADV. SRI.V.M.ALI RESPONDENT (S) /DE-FACTO COMPLAINANT: 1. STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY ITS PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM - 682 031. 2. SALMA GEORGE, D/O. GEORGE, AGED 30, PHILIPS HOUSE, KUTHURACHIRA, PUNALUR P.O., KOLLAM DISTRICT. R2 BY ADV. SRI.R.KRISHNAKUMAR (CHERTHALA) R BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR C.N.PRABHAKARAN THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 07-12-2017, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: a rae Se Si dena 2017/KER/49562 Cr1.MC.No. 7796 of 2017 () APPENDIX PETITIONER (S)' EXHIBITS ANNEXURE 1 THE CERTIFIED COPY OF THE FINAL REPORT IN C.C.NO. 1277/2016. ANNEXURE 2 A TRUE COPY OF THE COMPROMISE SUBMITTED BEFORE FAMILY COURT, ERNAKULAM. ANNEXURE 3 AFFIDAVIT SUBMITTED BY THE DE-FACTO COMPLAINANT. RESPONDENT (S)' EXHIBITS eee Tare aT OEE TOTTI NIL /TRUE COPY/ PS TO JUDGE. 2017/KER/49562 SUNIL THOMAS, J. Crl.M.C.No. 7796 of 2017 Dated this the 7" day of December, 2017 ORDER The petitioners herein are the accused Nos. 1,2 and 3 in CC No.1277/2016 of the JFCMC, Angamaly for offences punishable under sections 406,498A and 34 IPC. 2. It was alleged by the second respondent herein that, she was subjected to matrimonial cruelty by the first petitioner-her husband and in-laws. On the basis of the complaint lodged, the crime was registered and investigation was completed. According to the petitioners and the learned counsel for the contesting respondent, the disputes between the parties have been completely settled to the satisfaction of both the sides. To support that, Annexure 3 affidavit of the defacto complainant is produced. It is stated therein that, all the matrimonial disputes have been settled and Annexure A2 compromise was arrived at. 3. Learned Public Prosecutor, on instructions, submitted that the disputes have been settled and it is informed to the investigating agency. In the light of the above, I am inclined to PEmaNel ape ee 2017/KER/49562 Cr.M.C.No.7796/2017 2 invoke the jurisdiction of this court under section 482 Cr.P.C.to quash the proceedings. Accordingly, Cril.M.C.is allowed. All further proceedings pursuant to C.C.No.12787/2016 of the JFCMC, Ankamaly stand quashed. Sd/- SUNIL THOMAS Judge dpk /true copy/ PS to Judge.
